modules.title: Understanding Wallets
modules.description: Learn the fundamentals of cryptocurrency wallets

lessons.title: What is a Cryptocurrency Wallet?
lessons.content:
A cryptocurrency wallet is a digital tool that allows you to store, send, and receive cryptocurrencies. Unlike traditional bank accounts, crypto wallets give you complete control over your funds.

**Key Concepts:**
â€¢ **Private Keys**: Secret codes that prove ownership of your crypto
â€¢ **Public Addresses**: Public identifiers others use to send you crypto
â€¢ **Seed Phrases**: Backup words to recover your wallet
â€¢ **Non-Custodial**: You control your keys, not a bank

**Security Principle**: Whoever controls the private keys controls the cryptocurrency. This is why wallet security is absolutely critical.

lessons.title: Types of Wallets
lessons.content:
There are several types of wallets, each with different security characteristics:

**Hot Wallets** (Connected to internet):
â€¢ Exchange wallets (Coinbase, Binance)
â€¢ Web wallets (MetaMask, Phantom)
â€¢ Mobile wallets (Trust Wallet, Exodus)

**Cold Wallets** (Offline):
â€¢ Hardware wallets (Ledger, Trezor)
â€¢ Paper wallets
â€¢ Air-gapped computers

**Security Trade-offs**:
â€¢ Hot wallets: Convenient but more vulnerable
â€¢ Cold wallets: More secure but less convenient

**Recommendation**: Use hot wallets for small amounts and daily transactions, cold wallets for significant holdings.

modules.title: Setting Up Your First Wallet
modules.description: Step-by-step guide to creating a secure wallet

lessons.title: Choosing the Right Wallet
lessons.content:
When choosing your first wallet, consider these factors:

**Security Level**:
â€¢ For small amounts (<$100): Hot wallet is fine
â€¢ For significant amounts: Hardware wallet recommended

**Ease of Use**:
â€¢ Beginners: Start with user-friendly options like MetaMask
â€¢ Advanced users: Can handle more complex setups

**Supported Cryptocurrencies**:
â€¢ Make sure your wallet supports the cryptocurrencies you want to use
â€¢ Some wallets are chain-specific (e.g., Phantom for Solana)

**Backup Options**:
â€¢ Look for wallets with good backup and recovery features
â€¢ Ensure you can export your private keys if needed

lessons.title: Installing MetaMask
lessons.content:
**Step 1: Download MetaMask**
â€¢ Go to metamask.io (official site only)
â€¢ Click 'Download' and install the browser extension
â€¢ Never download from third-party sites

**Step 2: Create Your Wallet**
â€¢ Click 'Create a Wallet'
â€¢ Choose a strong password (12+ characters)
â€¢ Write down your recovery phrase (12 words)
â€¢ Store the recovery phrase securely offline

**Step 3: Verify Your Setup**
â€¢ Test with a small transaction
â€¢ Ensure you can send and receive crypto
â€¢ Verify your backup works

**Security Tips**:
â€¢ Never share your recovery phrase
â€¢ Store it in multiple secure locations
â€¢ Consider using a hardware wallet for large amounts
